intro: Kokera celosiodes, commonly known as the slender kokera, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, which includes many diverse and widespread orchid species. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, delicate flowers that often have a greenish or yellowish hue. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky areas. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Kokera celosiodes is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
